title: GTP' Agent Preparations - MediationZone Documentation 9.4 - InfoZone
text: If you want to ensure that a specific IP address is used for the GTP' agent, you must set the property mz.gtp.server.host in the execution container: $ mzsh topo set topo://container:<container name>/pico:<ec name>/val:config.properties.mz.gtp.server.host '<host address or name>' For this change to take effect, you must restart the EC after setting this property. If this property is not set, the agent will listen on the host set in the property pico.rcp.server.host in the container.conf . If the property pico.rcp.server.host is not set in the container.conf , the agent listen on all interfaces.

chunks.text: If you want to ensure that a specific IP address is used for the GTP' agent, you must set the property mz.gtp.server.host in the execution container: $ mzsh topo set topo://container:<container name>/pico:<ec name>/val:config.properties.mz.gtp.server.host '<host address or name>' For this change to take effect, you must restart the EC after setting this property. If this property is not set, the agent will listen on the host set in the property pico.rcp.server.host in the container.conf . If the property pico.rcp.server.host is not set in the container.conf , the agent listen on all interfaces.
